page.title: 09TOURISM
page.content: TOUR The biggest tourist attraction is the Pagham Harbour Nature Reserve. This was founded 19 years ago and is a home for many wild creatures. Each year there are about 50,000 visitors, mostly in Spring and Autumn when birds are migrating. Sidlesham does not have many places where tourists can stay. There is no hotel but two or three village houses offer Bed and Breakfast accomodation. There are two Public houses which attract visitors.In the summer they prouide Bar snacks. One "The Anchor" is on the main road through the village to Selsey. The other, "The Crab and Lobster" is near the harbour and Nature Reserve. There are two Caravan Club certificated sites in the village. These can take a maximum of five touring caravans.
